subject: Design
subcategory: Famous Logos and Their Hidden Stories
title: Lacoste: The Crocodile's Bet
description: One-minute skill: Lacoste: The Crocodile's Bet.

hook.text: Tennis star RenÃ© Lacoste got his 'crocodile' nickname after a bet over a crocodile-skin suitcase.

buildup.text: A friend drew a crocodile for him, and Lacoste embroidered it on his tennis blazer.

discovery.text: In 1933, it became the first visible logo on clothing. Before Lacoste, labels were hidden inside.

twist.text: Lacoste invented the concept of wearing a brand. Every visible swoosh and polo player follows his lead.

climax.text: A tennis player's personal joke became the foundation of visible brand identity in fashion.

punchline.text: The first fashion logo started as a bet and a joke.

quiz.question: What was revolutionary about the Lacoste crocodile?
options: It was the first logo worn visibly on clothing
